intro: Schizachyrium hirtiflorum, commonly known as hairyflower little bluestem, is a native grass species found in the eastern and central United States. It is characterized by its fine, blue-green foliage and its distinctive, hairy flower clusters that appear in late summer. This plant typically grows in full sun and thrives in well-drained soils, making it a common sight in prairies and open woodlands. Schizachyrium hirtiflorum is a perennial grass that plays an important role in stabilizing soil and supporting local wildlife. Its ornamental value has also made it a popular choice for native plant gardens.
